result.execSummary:
The defendant Patrick J Hemp was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Outstanding obligations are not a condition of probation and are to be paid directly to the Menominee Co. Clerk of Court office within 60 days. Debts older than 90 days  will be processed for tax intercept and civil judgments. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Payments plans are available.

Defendant Patrick J Hemp in court. Prosecuting Atty Scott E. Niemi appeared for State of Wisconsin. defendant wants an attorney-court $500.00 signature bond with pictures and prints  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for November 28, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Mr. Hemp called me last week to ask "how is he supposed to represent himself"? and why didn't he recieve "something' in the mail? Spoke with Chris in the DA's office and gave her the mailing address Mr, Hemp gave me. I also informed him of his court date of November 21, 2016 at 1:30pm.
